home.title: Introduction to internationalisation
home.subtitle: Internationalisation (software development)
home.content1: In computer science and software development, internationalisation means designing a program in such a way that it can be easily adapted to other languages and cultures (without having to change the source code ).
home.content2: Internationalisationis often abbreviated with the numeronym i18n (in the English word internationalisation there are 18 letters between the first letter I and the last letter n).
home.content3: This includes the tasks that the developer/programmer of a programme has to master. For example, they may not hard-code descriptive texts in the source code, but must use variables that are read in from a source at runtime. This also includes date formatting and language-dependent interface design (e.g. text can be of different lengths or the right-to-left orientation can differ).

imprint.title: Imprint
imprint.author: Author
imprint.content: This website was created as part of my bachelor thesis to demonstrate the internationalisation of websites. The content is fictitious and is for demonstration purposes only. Any translation errors are to be apologised for.
